question: Question_07_(b)
statement:
In an experiment involving a bacteria population, $N(t)$ denotes the
size of the population (measured in thousands of individuals) as a
function of time, starting at $t=0$. The initial population is
$N(0) = N_{0}$.

b) Suppose the population growth is governed by the differential
equation

$\displaystyle \frac{dN}{dt} = \frac{N^{2}}{(t+1)^{2}}$

Find $N(t)$ if $N(0)=2$.
